rsn: When comparing the two images, we can observe that the orientation of the bathtub and the surrounding objects has changed slightly. In the source image, the bathtub appears more tilted towards the left side compared to the target image. This suggests that the camera was rotated counterclockwise to align the bathtub more horizontally in the target image. The relative positions of the shower head, bottles, and other items also support this observation as they appear to have shifted in a manner consistent with a counterclockwise rotation.
label: clockwise

rsn: Observing the two images, the primary difference lies in the orientation of the window blinds and the overall alignment of objects within the room. In the source image, the blinds appear slightly tilted towards the left side of the frame, while in the target image, they are more aligned with the vertical axis. This suggests a rotation of the camera. Specifically, the transition from the source to the target image indicates that the camera has been rotated counterclockwise, as the blinds have shifted from a tilted position to a more upright position.
label: clockwise

rsn: When comparing the two images, we observe that the orientation of the bathtub and the surrounding objects has changed slightly. In the source image, the bathtub appears more aligned with the horizontal plane of the image, while in the target image, it seems to be tilted slightly upwards towards the right side. This suggests that the camera has been rotated clockwise around its viewing axis, causing the scene to appear as if it's tilted in the opposite direction.
label: clockwise

rsn: Observing the two images, the primary difference lies in the orientation of the window blinds and the angle at which the room's features are captured. In the source image, the blinds appear more vertical, while in the target image, they seem slightly tilted. This suggests a rotation of the camera. Specifically, the transition from the source to the target image indicates that the camera has been rotated counterclockwise, as the left side of the image appears to have shifted upward relative to the right side.
label: clockwise
